question: What services do you offer?
answer: I am a full stack developer who had previously worked as a JavaScript consultant.  I am able to quickly find meaningful work to add to whatever project I am on.  Having been coding for several years, and recently completed a skill sharpening Web Development Immersive course over at General Assembly, I feel that I can add value to any team.

question: Do you custom design websites or use pre-made templates?
answer: This question would be answered either by the client or the business I am currently working with.  If they want a totally greenfield solution, I can do that.  If they want me to spruce up their CMS with custom code, I can also do that.  However, I prefer to make sites.

question: What industry sites and blogs do you read regularly?
answer: I read Geekwire, WebDeveloper Reddit, HackerNews.  I also have a active subscription to Pluralsight to keep me up to date with how to use new tech.

question: Do you prefer to work alone or on a team?
answer: I prefer to work on a team, however if I just have a task I need to get done, then then I prefer to put in my headphones and work.

question: What are a few of your favorite development tools and why?
answer: I really like Visual Studio Code.  I have used Sublime, Atom, and just a text editor before, but I like how VS code rolls a lot of things into one and provides a 'app' store for extensions.

question: What skills and technologies are you the most interested in improving upon or learning?
answer: Always keeping up on my coding skills, there is just so much to learn and to know, and with technology moving so fast you have to be constantly learning.  I am also interested in internet of things (IoT), it seems like a awesome way to solve problems by setting up an array of sensors.

question: What web browser do you use?
answer: When developing, all of them.  Personal use Google Chrome.

question: What are a few personal web projects you've got going on?
answer: A friend of mine and I are building out features on a IoT home care system.  I am also working with a few other developers to make a mobile game.
